CodeList.Name: Amendment Details Statement Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the amendment details statement responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Not applicable. This protocol has not been amended.
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Not applicable. This protocol has not been amended.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: This is the first protocol amendment.
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: This is the first protocol amendment.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: This protocol has been amended previously. Details of prior amendments are presented in Section 12.3 Prior Protocol Amendments.
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: This protocol has been amended previously. Details of prior amendments are presented in Section 12.3 Prior Protocol Amendments.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: This protocol has been amended previously. The Protocol Amendment Summary of Changes for the current amendment is located directly before the Table of Contents. Prior amendment(s) to this protocol are listed in the table below, beginning with the most recent.
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: This protocol has been amended previously. The Protocol Amendment Summary of Changes for the current amendment is located directly before the Table of Contents. Prior amendment(s) to this protocol are listed in the table below, beginning with the most recent.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Protocol Previously Amended See Summary of Changes Before the Table of Contents

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Amendment Details Statement Value Set Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217275.Amendment Scope Enrollment Description Response Terminology
CodeList.Name: Amendment Scope Enrollment Description Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the amendment scope enrollment description responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Covering or affecting a cohort of individuals.
Covering or affecting the whole of a system.
Covering or affecting a portion of the system.

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: Amendment Scope Enrollment Description Response Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Amendment Scope Enrollment Description Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Amendment Scope Enrollment Description Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Amendment Scope Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the amendment scope value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Covering or affecting the whole of a system.
Covering or affecting a portion of the system.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Amendment Scope Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Control Type Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the control type responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A type of control, which has a demonstrated effect, administered as a comparator to participants in a clinical trial.
A type of control that comprises a different dose or dosage regimen in comparison to the investigational intervention dose or dosage regimen.
A type of control using different doses or regimens of the same treatment across the treatment arms.
The use of external control data as a control arm for those studies where ethical concerns and/or underserved disease indications may make it difficult to enroll participants.
A clinical study that lacks a comparison (i.e., a control) group.
An inactive, identical-appearing drug or treatment that does not contain the test product.
A type of negative control in which a procedure is performed that mimics the procedure under study but does not include investigational processes or components.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Control Type Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 1 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 1 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An indication as to whether the clinical trial uses an adaptive trial design.
A narrative providing additional details about the duration of an participant's use of a trial intervention or their planned participation time in the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Alternate Description of Planned Duration of Trial Intervention
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An alternative textual narrative for the planned duration of trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Alternate Description of Planned Duration of Trial Intervention

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Alternate Description of Planned Duration of Trial Participation
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An alternative narrative for the planned duration of trial participation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Alternate Description of Planned Duration of Trial Participation

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An identifying designation assigned to a blinded individual within a clinical trial that corresponds with their function.
A characterisation or classification of the comparator against which the study intervention is evaluated.
An indication as to whether the clinical trial is testing a drug-device combination product.
An independent group of experts that has oversight over, and conducts periodic review of, specific trial activities.
A unique name that is globally recognised and public property, which identifies pharmaceutical substances or active pharmaceutical ingredients.
The technique used to assign trial participants to a trial intervention or trial arm.
The overall design configuration for assigning intervention to participants.
An indication as to whether the protocol is a master protocol.
The anticipated maximum age of the participants to be entered in a clinical trial.
The anticipated minimum age of the participants to be entered in a clinical trial.
Drug name that is not protected by a trademark, usually descriptive of its chemical structure, and sometimes a public name. (ICH E2B)
The planned number of intervention groups.
The planned number of participants to be entered in a clinical trial.
A committee that is different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A description of the condition, disease or disorder that the clinical trial is intended to investigate or address.
A characterisation or classification of the trial population.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Primary and Secondary Objectives and Estimands
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A descriptive summary of the primary and secondary objectives and their associated estimands related to the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Primary and Secondary Objectives and Estimands Summary

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The target or maximum number of participants who have been randomly assigned to the trial intervention or enrolled in the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Number of Participants Randomly Assigned to Trial Intervention or Enrolled

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A standardised representation of planned clinical trial activities including interventions (e.g., administering drug, surgery) and study administrative activities (e.g., obtaining informed consent, distributing clinical trial material and diaries, randomisation) as well as assessments.
A brief written record describing the trial schematic.
An indication as to whether the occurrence applies to a single or multiple trial sites.
An indication as to whether the trial is taking place in one or more countries.
A characterisation or classification of the trial participant numbers as to whether the numbers reflect a target or maximum.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Participation Number Target or Maximum Indicator

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Total Planned Duration of Trial Intervention Unit of Time
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The unit of time associated with the numeric value for the planned duration of trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Planned Duration of Trial Intervention Unit of Time

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Total Planned Duration of Trial Intervention
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The numeric value for the planned duration of trial intervention.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Total Planned Duration of Trial Participation Unit of Time
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The unit of time associated with the numeric value for the planned duration of trial participation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Planned Duration of Trial Participation Unit of Time

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Total Planned Duration of Trial Participation
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The numeric value for the planned duration of trial participation.

The type of experimental design used to describe the level of awareness of the trial participants and/ or personnel as it relates to the respective intervention(s) or assessments being observed, received or administered.
A diagram that outlines the decision points (e.g. randomisation, response evaluation) that define the different paths a participant could take through the trial.
Those units of time that are routinely used to express the age of a person.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 1 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 10 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 10 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Analyses of Demographics and Other Baseline Variables
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of analyses relevant to variables at baseline, for example demographics, related to the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Description of Trial Baseline Variable Analysis

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the statistical model, hypothesis, and methods of analyses for each exploratory objective within the trial.
A description of the set of participants whose data are to be included in the analyses.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Description of the Participants Included in Data Analysis

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Careful thought or deliberation related to the planned conduct of statistical analyses within the context of the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Handling of Data in Relation to Primary Estimand(s)
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how data will be handled for the statistical analysis in line with the primary estimand.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Handling of Data in Relation to Primary Estimand(s)

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Handling of Data in Relation to Secondary Estimand(s)
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how data will be handled for the statistical analysis in line with the secondary estimand.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Handling of Data in Relation to Secondary Estimand(s)

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Handling of Missing Data in Relation to Primary Estimand(s)
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how missing data associated with the primary estimand will be handled, including the rationale for the approach.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Handling of Missing Data in Relation to Primary Estimand(s)

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Handling of Missing Data in Relation to Secondary Estimand(s)
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how missing data associated with the secondary estimand will be handled, including the rationale for the approach.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Handling of Missing Data in Relation to Secondary Estimand(s)

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of any analysis intended to compare treatment arms with respect to efficacy or safety at any time prior to the formal completion of a trial.
A description of the statistical adjustments needed to limit the probability of false positive findings in trials where there are multiple simultaneous hypotheses.
A description of the analyses that are different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A description of the analyses of relevant safety variables, including adverse events of special interest.

A statistical calculation to determine the number of participants required for the primary analysis, which should be large enough to provide a reliable answer to the questions addressed and should be determined by the primary objective of the trial. If the sample size is determined on some other basis, then this should be made clear and justified.
A description of the series of analyses conducted to explore the robustness of inferences from the main estimator to deviations from its underlying modeling assumptions and limitations in the data.
A description of the statistical model, hypothesis, and methods of analyses for each objective within the trial.
A description of the analyses that are conducted in addition to the main and sensitivity analysis with the intent to provide additional insights into the understanding of the treatment effect.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 10 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 11 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 11 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the type and administrative structure of any committee associated with the trial.
The requirements that must be met in order to close a trial site prematurely.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Criteria for Early Trial Site Closure

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of whether and which public databases the clinical trial, and results if applicable, will be registered.
A description of the key processes to ensure data integrity, traceability and security, in order to enable accurate collection, reporting, monitoring, transfer, retention, access and publication.

A description of the measures taken to protect the privacy and confidentiality of person information of trial participants in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements on personal data protection and any measures that should be taken in case of a data security breach.
A description of the legal principles of entitlement for the sponsor to close a trial site, or for the investigator to initiate the closure of a trial site.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Decision Rights for Trial Site Closure

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the assent process for those individuals unable to give informed consent on their own behalf, to participate in the trial.
A type of informed consent process that may occur during an emergency situation in which the participant or their legally authorised representative is not available to give consent.

The procedure by which informed consent is obtained and documented by means of a written, signed, and dated informed consent form. This process may include obtaining assent from participants with legally authorised representatives.
A description of how trial-related source data will be identified.
A description of the consent requirements for participants in the event of screen failure and rescreening.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Informed Consent for Use of Remaining Samples in Exploratory Research
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the consent requirements for exploratory research using the remainder of mandatory samples. If applicable, this may include text in the original consent that address the use of remaining samples or additional text.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Informed Consent Requirements for Use of Remaining Samples in Exploratory Research

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A concise summary of the arrangements for participants insurance and indemnity as required by the applicable regulatory body.
A description of the obligations of the investigator with respect to maintaining and ensuring availability of the source data.
A description of the obligations of the investigator with respect to the trial.
A description of plans for detecting, reviewing, and reporting any deviations from the protocol.
Careful thought or deliberation related to the regulatory and ethical aspects of the trial.
The responsibilities of the sponsor and/or investigator following an unplanned early termination or suspension of the trial at an individual site.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Responsibilities Following Early Trial Site Closure

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how potential risks and critical to quality factors associated with the trial will be identified and handled.
A description of trial-related source data including the importance of source data maintenance and expectations for data traceability.
A description of the obligations of the sponsor with respect to the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Trial Monitor Expectations for Source Data
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the obligations of the trial monitor with respect to maintaining and ensuring availability of the source data.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Monitor Expectations for Source Data

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the planned processes and procedures to govern and conduct a clinical trial in order to protect the rights, safety and welfare of the trial participants.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 11 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 12 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 12 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a protocol amendment.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Approximate Enrolled At Time of Sponsor Approval
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The value (expressed either numerically or as a percentage) for the estimated number of participants enrolled at the time of the protocol amendment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Approximate Participant Enrollment At Time of Sponsor Approval

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The brief reason for the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A sequence of characters used to identify and/or name a country or region.
A description of any country or region-specific clarifications related to a protocol item.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Country and/or Region-Specific Protocol Clarifications Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of any country or region-specific requirements related to the trial but not related to individual items in the protocol.
A description of the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.
An indication as to whether the protocol has not been amended, is the first protocol amendment, or a statement that the protocol has been amended previously.
The protocol section number and name containing the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Protocol Change Section Number and Name

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The physical or virtual location of the overview of changes from each prior amendment.
The date that the sponsor approved the current version of the protocol.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 12 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 13 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 13 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A list of terms with their abbreviations and/or definitions.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 13 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 14 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 14 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The curated list of sources that are cited within the reference section of the document.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 14 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 2 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 2 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A short textual description containing the potential physical, psychological, social, legal, and other benefits to the trial participant.
A short textual description containing the risks and benefits associated with participation in the trial.
The overall rationale, reason, or intention of the clinical trial.
A description of the potential risks associated with the trial interventions and mitigation strategies to be employed within the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial-specific Intervention Risks and Mitigation Strategy Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the potential risks associated with the trial procedures and mitigation strategies to be employed within the trial that are different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial-specific Other Risks and Mitigation Strategy Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the potential risks associated with the trial procedures and mitigation strategies to be employed within the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial-specific Procedure Risks and Mitigation Strategy Description

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 2 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 3 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 3 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the intercurrent event.
The variable to be obtained for each patient that is required to address the clinical question. The specification of the variable might include whether the patient experiences an intercurrent event.
The exploratory reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
A description of the planned strategy to address intercurrent events.

The population of patients targeted by the clinical question. This will be represented by the entire trial population, a subgroup defined by a particular characteristic measured at baseline, or a principal stratum defined by the occurrence (or non-occurrence, depending on context) of a specific intercurrent event.
Population level summary for the clinical endpoint of interest, which provides a basis for comparison between treatment conditions.
The principle reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
The secondary reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.

The treatment condition of interest and, as appropriate, the alternative treatment condition to which comparison will be made (referred to as "treatment" through the remainder of this document). These might be individual interventions, combinations of interventions administered concurrently, e.g. as add-on to standard of care, or might consist of an overall regimen involving a complex sequence of interventions.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 3 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 4 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 4 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Access to Trial Intervention after End of Trial
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A narrative description containing information about whether and how trial participants have access to the trial interventions after the trial ends.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Access to Trial Intervention after End of Trial

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An extra or further textual description of the trial design.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Description of Level and Method of Blinding
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the level of awareness of the study participants and/or personnel to the respective intervention(s) or assessments being observed, received or administered, and the methodology by which study participants or personnel are blinded.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Description of Level and Method of Blinding

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the trial duration.
A description containing a concise explanation, any local regulatory requirements and considerations, extensions, follow-up, and analysis for the trial end.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Method of Assignment to Trial Intervention
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The technique used to assign trial participants to a trial intervention or trial arm.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Overall Description of Trial Design and Description of Intervention Model
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description summarizing the overall trial design and intervention model.
An explanation as to the scientific reasons for the choice of the trial design.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Rationale for Adaptive or Novel Trial Design
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An explanation as to the scientific reasons for why an adaptive or novel trial design was chosen for the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Rationale for Adaptive or Novel Trial Design

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An explanation as to the scientific reasons for the choice of the control types used in the trial.
An explanation as to the scientific reasons for the choice of the trial estimand(s).
An explanation for the analysis comparing intervention groups at any time before the formal completion of the trial, usually before recruitment is complete. (CDISC Glossary)
An explanation as to the scientific reasons for why the intervention model was chosen for the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Rationale for Other Trial Design Aspects
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An explanation as to the scientific reasons for additional trial design considerations that are different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Rationale for Other Trial Design Aspects

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An explanation as to the scientific reasons for the trial duration.
A description of the way in which trial stakeholders were consulted when determining the trial design and how that input was applied.
A description containing a concise explanation, any local regulatory requirements and considerations, extensions, follow-up, and analysis for the trial start.

A criterion that, when met by the accumulating data, indicates that the trial can or should be stopped early to avoid putting participants at risk unnecessarily or because the intervention effect is so great that further data collection is unnecessary.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 4 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 5 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 5 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Caffeine, Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Restrictions
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the restrictions related to participant intake of caffeine, alcohol, tobacco, and other habit-forming substances during the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Participant Caffeine, Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substance Restrictions

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the requirements for the prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery within a context of a trial, or state not applicable.
A concise explanation of the meaning of participants of childbearing potential and non-childbearing potential within the context of a trial, or state not applicable.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Definitions Related to Trial Participant Childbearing Potential

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Description of Trial Population and Rationale
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the rationale for selection of trial population describing how the selected population can meet the trial objectives and how the enrollment criteria reflect the targeted populations.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Description of Trial Population and Rationale

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: List of characteristics in a protocol, any one of which excludes a potential participant from participation in a study. (CDISC glossary)
The criteria in a protocol that prospective participants must meet to be eligible for participation in a study. (CDISC glossary)
A description of the restrictions related to trial participant lifestyle such as diet, substance intake, and physical or other daily activities.
A description of the restrictions related to participant diet during the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Participant Meals and Dietary Restrictions

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An activity restriction that is different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A description of the restrictions related to participant physical activity during the trial.
The process of active consideration of participants for enrollment in a trial, for those potential participants who have failed a prior screening attempt.
The potential participant who does not meet eligibility (inclusion/exclusion) criteria during the screening period.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 5 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 6 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 6 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The act or process for documenting the storage, inventory tracking, and disposition of the investigational trial intervention.
The literal identifier (i.e. distinctive designation) for the arm.
A characterisation or classification of the study arm.

Medicinal products that are administered to each clinical trial participant, regardless of randomization group, a) to treat the indication which is the object of the study, or b) required in the protocol as part of standard care for a condition that is not the indication under investigation, and is relevant for the clinical trial design. (CDISC Glossary)
Any pharmaceutical agent, other than the trial interventions, that is administered to or used by the participant prior to or during a specified time period.
A description of the investigational trial intervention.
A description of the noninvestigational trial intervention.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Description of the Overview of Trial intervention or a Heading for the Optional Table
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A free text description of the trial intervention; alternatively can be used as a heading for a table containing information about the trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Intervention Overview or Informational Table Header

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Specified quantity of a medicine, to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.
The strength of a drug product, which indicates the amount of each active ingredient in a given dosage form, measured in units of volume or concentration.
A description of the methodology used for unblinding of the trial treatment in the case of a sudden unforeseen crisis that requires immediate medical care of the participant.
An indication as to whether the investigational intervention is an investigational medicinal product or an auxiliary medicinal product.
The literal identifier (i.e. distinctive designation) for the study intervention.
The kind of product or procedure studied in a trial.

A description of the measures taken to ensure trial intervention adherence, including mandatory documentation to be filled out and the source data that will be used to document investigational trial intervention compliance.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Investigational Trial Intervention Adherence Measures Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The way in which the investigational trial intervention is dispensed, applied, or tendered to the trial participant.
A change, alteration, or adjustment to the dose of an investigational trial intervention.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Management of Investigational Trial Intervention Overdose
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of how a potential investigational trial intervention overdose will be handled.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Management of Investigational Trial Intervention Overdose

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the measures taken to ensure the blinding is maintained.
A noninvestigational intervention that is different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Participant Assignment to Investigational Trial Intervention
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The technique used to assign trial participants to a trial arm.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Participant Assignment to Investigational Intervention Method

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Concomitant therapy that is approved for use in the trial.

Physical characteristics of a drug product, (e.g., tablet, capsule, or solution) that contains a drug substance, generally-but not necessarily-in association with one or more other ingredients. (CDISC Glossary)
The way in which the investigational trial intervention is prepared for use or administration to the trial participant.
Concomitant therapy that is banned from use in the trial.
The process of assigning trial participants to treatment or control groups using an element of chance to determine the assignments in order to reduce bias. (CDISC Glossary)

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Rationale for Investigational Trial Intervention Dose and Regimen
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An explanation as to the scientific reasons for the choice of the trial intervention dose and dose regimen.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Rationale for Investigational Trial Intervention Dose and Regimen

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the schedule and periodicity of a treatment or vaccination regimen.

Any rescue medications, treatments, and/or procedures identified in the protocol as those that may be administered to participants when the efficacy of the investigational intervention is not satisfactory, its effect is too great and is likely to cause a hazard to the participant, or to manage an emergency situation. (CDISC Glossary)
Path by which the pharmaceutical product is taken into or makes contact with the body.
An indication as to whether the investigational intervention is centrally or locally sourced.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Storage and Handling of Investigational Trial Intervention
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A narrative description containing information about the handling, storage, and distribution of investigational trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Clinical Trial Investigational Product Handling Instruction Documentation

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The reason or intention for the use of the trial intervention within the trial arm.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 6 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 7 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 7 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The mitigation strategies to be employed for the loss or lack of continuation of a participant to follow-up, including the frequency by which follow-up occurs.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Participant Discontinuation or Withdrawal from Trial
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The rationale for why the participant either discontinued or withdrew from the trial.
The requirements that must be met in order to permanently discontinue the administration of trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Requirements for Permanent Discontinuation of Trial Intervention

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The requirements that must be met in order to reintroduce previously withdrawn or temporarily discontinued medical intervention in the same participant.
The requirements that must be met in order to temporarily discontinue the administration of trial intervention.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Requirements for Temporary Discontinuation of Trial Intervention

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 7 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 8 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 8 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Trial assessments and procedures related to the baseline epoch of the trial.
Trial-related laboratory assessments and procedures.
Trial assessments and procedures related to trial intervention efficacy.

The procedures for the recordings produced by the variations in electrical potential caused by electrical activity of the heart muscle and detected at the body surface, as a method for studying the action of the heart muscle.
A narrative description containing information about the collection, use, and retention of biospecimens, and their use in genetic and pharmacogenomic biomarker assessments within the trial.
A narrative description containing information about the collection, use, and retention of biospecimens, and their use in immunogenicity assessments within the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Medical Resource Utilisation and Health Economics
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A narrative description containing information about medical resource utilisation and the health outcome measures, collection method and participant burden.
A narrative description containing information about the collection, use, and retention of biospecimens, and their use in other biomarker assessments within the trial.
A narrative description containing information about the collection, use, and retention of biospecimens, and their use in pharmacodynamic biomarker assessments within the trial.
A narrative description containing information about the collection, use, and retention of biospecimens, and their use in pharmacokinetic assessments within the trial.
The procedures for a physical examination of the body and its functions to be conducted for the trial.
Any examination performed to assess if a female is gravid.
A description of the assessments and procedures related to participant safety within the trial.
Trial assessments and procedures related to the screening epoch of the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Suicidal Ideation and Behaviour Risk Monitoring
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of data collection procedures and analysis related to suicidal ideation and behaviour risk monitoring.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Suicidal Ideation and Behaviour Risk Monitoring

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of general considerations applicable across trial assessments and procedures.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Trial Assessments and Procedures Considerations Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The procedures for measurements of the body's basic functions that provide insight into the health status of the person.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 8 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section 9 Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in section 9 of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the processes and procedures used to define, measure, confirm, and report the occurrence of adverse events that are of special interest to the specific trial, or state not applicable.

A description of alternative techniques by which trial related events, such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events, are reported to the sponsor and/or regulatory authority.
The description of the degree of causality (attributability) between a trial intervention and an event.
A concise explanation of the meaning of adverse events within the context of the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Definitions of Medical Device Product Complaints
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A concise explanation of the meaning of medical device product complaints within the context of the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Definition of Medical Device Product Complaints

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A concise explanation of the meaning of product complaints within the context of the trial.
A concise explanation of the meaning of serious adverse events within the context of the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Disease-related Events or Outcomes Not Qualifying as AEs or SAEs
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of events or outcomes related to the trial disease indication but not qualifying as adverse events or serious adverse events within the trial, or state not applicable.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Disease-related Events or Outcomes Not Qualifying as Adverse Events or Serious Adverse Events

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the timing as it relates to the collection and reporting of trial related events, and the frequency of collection of those events to the sponsor or designee.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Event Collection and Reporting Timing Description

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A characterisation or classification of trial-related safety events, such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events.
A description of the procedures for follow-up, including the assessment tools that will be used to monitor an event and the duration of follow-up.

A description of how trial-related events, such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events, will be identified.

A description of the technique by which trial related events, such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events, are reported to the sponsor and/or regulatory authority.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Participants Who Become Pregnant During the Trial
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the processes and procedures used to collect pregnancy data for a trial participant who becomes pregnant while the participant is in the trial, as well as data collection about the foetus, neonate, infant, or child.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Participants Who Become Pregnant During the Trial Data Collection

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Participants Whose Partners Become Pregnant During the Trial
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the processes and procedures used to collect pregnancy data for a trial participant's partner, who becomes pregnant while the participant is in the trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Participants Whose Partners Become Pregnant During the Trial Data Collection

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description for the procedures used to document an event.

A description of the requirements for the sponsor/designee to report adverse events, serious adverse events, pregnancy and postpartum events, and medical device product complaints, including the criteria for reporting, to the relevant regulatory authority.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Regulatory Reporting Requirements for Trial-Related Events

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The date on which reporting will cease for trial related events such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events.

The date on which reporting will begin for trial related events such as adverse events, serious adverse events, product complaints, medical device product complaints, and pregnancy and postpartum events.
A description of the method and timelines for reporting adverse events, serious adverse events, pregnancy and postpartum events, and medical device product complaints to the sponsor.
The description of the intensity (severity) of an event.
A description of the specific circumstances and context in which safety events are collected and monitored.

A characterisation or classification of those trial specific situations that are associated with the trial intervention(s) and require regulatory reporting, but that do not qualify as an adverse event or serious adverse event for the given trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Timing for Reporting to Sponsor or Designee
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the timing window between trial related events and their reporting to the sponsor or designee.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Timing Description for Reporting to Sponsor or Designee

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section 9 Data Element Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217357.ICH M11 Section Amendment Details Terminology
CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section Amendment Details Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in the amendment details section of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A written message within the study protocol that describes the amendment details, especially as to whether the protocol has been amended previously.
The enrollment description as to whether the amendment scope applies globally, locally, or per cohort across the trial.
A short description describing the changes introduced in the current version of the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Approximate Enrolled At Time of Sponsor Approval
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The value (expressed either numerically or as a percentage) for the estimated number of participants enrolled at the time of the protocol amendment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Approximate Participant Enrollment At Time of Sponsor Approval

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The brief reason for the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Briefly Explain Substantial Impact on Data
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A short descriptive account of any substantial impacts on the reliability and robustness of the data generated in the clinical trial due to the protocol amendment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Brief Explanation of Substantial Impact on Study Data

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Briefly Explain Substantial Impact On Safety
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A short descriptive account of any substantial impacts on the safety or rights of the participants due to the protocol amendment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Brief Explanation of Substantial Impact on Participant Safety

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A description of the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Is this amendment likely to have a substantial impact on the reliability and robustness of the data generated in the clinical trial?
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An indication as to whether the amendment likely to have a substantial impact on the reliability and robustness of the data generated in the clinical trial.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Amendment Impacts Reliability and Robustness of Data Indicator

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Is this amendment likely to have a substantial impact on the safety or rights of the participants?
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An indication as to whether the amendment is likely to have a substantial impact on the safety or rights of the participants.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Amendment Impacts Participant's Safety or Rights Indicator

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The rationale of greatest importance for the protocol amendment.
Additional rationale for the protocol amendment that is not considered the primary rationale.
The protocol section number and name containing the change introduced in the current or prior version of the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Protocol Change Section Number and Name

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: ICH M11 Section Amendment Details Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: ICH M11 Section Amendment Details Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section Amendment Details Data Element Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217356.ICH M11 Section Title Page Terminology
CodeList.Name: ICH M11 Section Title Page Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the data elements in the title page of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a protocol amendment.
A description as to whether the amendment scope applies globally across the trial.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Approval Date or State Location Where Information Can be Found
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The date that the sponsor approved the current or prior version of the protocol, or the physical or virtual location of the date on which the sponsor approved the current or prior version of the protocol, or state location where information can be found.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Protocol Approval Date or Location of Date

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The legally registered address of the trial co-sponsor.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the trial co-sponsor.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: contact information for medical expert (as designated by sponsor) or state location where information can be found
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The contact information for the sponsor's representative who can advise on specific trial-related medical questions or problems, or state location where information can be found.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Designated Medical Expert Contact Information or Location of Contact Information

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters used to identify and/or name the country.
The narrative text describing the technique used to approve the protocol.
The legally registered address of the device manufacturer.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the organisation defined as being responsible for creating the device as stated on the package in which the product is supplied.
A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial, as assigned by the Clinical Trials Information System (CTIS) of the European Medicines Agency.
A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial under an Investigational New Drug (IND) application, as assigned by the US Food and Drug Administration.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: US FDA Investigational New Drug Application Number

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The formal descriptive name for the protocol that contains key elements of the study. (CDISC)

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHSynonym: FDA Investigational Device Exemption Application Number
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial under an Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) application, as assigned by the US Food and Drug Administration.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: US FDA Investigational Device Exemption Application Number

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHSynonym: Japan Registry for Clinical Trials Number
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial, as assigned by the Japan Registry for Clinical Trials (JRCT) of the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (MHLW) in Japan.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Japan Registry for Clinical Trials Number

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The legally registered address of the sponsor's legal representative at a geographical region within which the sponsor has no legal presence.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the sponsor's legal representative at a geographical region within which the sponsor has no legal presence.
A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial, as assigned by the protocol registration and results (PRS) system of the US National Library of Medicine.
A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial under an Investigational New Drug (IND) application, as assigned by the Chinese National Medicinal Products Administration (NMPA).
Drug name that is not protected by a trademark, usually descriptive of its chemical structure, and sometimes a public name. (ICH E2B)
An indication as to whether the protocol document reflects the original version of the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Other Regulatory or Clinical Trial Identifier
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A sequence of characters assigned by a regulatory agency or other health authority that is used to identify a clinical trial, and that is different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Other Regulatory or Clinical Trial Identifier

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A commercial name granted by an authority for use in marketing/registering a product.
A sequence of characters used to identify and/or name the region.
A sequence of characters used to identify and/or name the study site.
A written message within the study protocol that asserts a statement of non-disclosure, such that information contained within the protocol document may only be shared with authorised parties.
The legally registered address of the trial sponsor.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the trial sponsor.
A sequence of characters assigned by the sponsor that uniquely identifies a specific protocol.
A symbol or combination of symbols that are assigned by the sponsor to uniquely identify an experimental intervention.
Acronym or abbreviation used publicly to identify the clinical trial.
A stage in the clinical research and development of a therapy from first-in-human to post-approval clinical trials.
The short descriptive name for the trial.
The date on which the document is versioned.
A string of alphanumeric characters that uniquely identifies a specific version of a study protocol.
A sequence of characters used to identify a clinical trial, as assigned by the World Health Organisation's International Clinical Trial's Registry Platform (ICTRP).

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: ICH M11 Section Title Page Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: ICH M11 Section Title Page Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section Title Page Data Element Terminology

CodeList.Name: Independent Committee Name Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the independent committee name responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A type of safety monitoring committee that monitors dose escalation activities in first-in-human trials.
An external committee whose purpose is to evaluate study data and decide whether a study endpoint or other criterion has been met.

A committee established by the sponsor to assess at intervals the progress of a clinical trial, safety data, and critical efficacy variables and recommend to the sponsor whether to continue, modify, or terminate the trial.
No person or thing, nobody, not any.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Independent Committee Name Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Intervention Model Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the intervention model responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Participants receive one of two or more alternative intervention(s) during the initial epoch of the study and receive other intervention(s) during the subsequent epoch(s) of the trial.

Two or more interventions, each alone or in combination, are evaluated in parallel against a control group. This study design allows for the comparison of active drug to placebo, presence of drug-drug interactions, and comparison of active drugs against each other.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Participants are assigned to one of two or more treatment groups in parallel for the duration of the study.
Groups of participants are assigned to receive interventions based on prior milestones being reached in the study.
All trial participants are assigned to a single treatment group for the duration of the study.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Intervention Model Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Intervention Type Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the intervention type responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A technique used to change the behavior of a participant (e.g., psychotherapy, lifestyle counseling, or hypnosis).

A product of biological origin applicable to the prevention, treatment, or cure of a disease or condition, for example: virus, therapeutic serum, toxin, antitoxin, vaccine, blood, blood component or derivative, allergenic product, or analogous product.

A product composed of two or more different types of medical products (i.e., a combination of a drug, device, and/or biological product with one another and are referred to as "constituent parts" of the combination product). (CDISC Glossary)

Any instrument, apparatus, implement, machine, appliance, implant, reagent for in vitro use, software, material or other similar or related article, intended by the manufacturer to be used, alone or in combination for, one or more specific medical purpose(s). (CDISC Glossary)
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.
Preparations containing ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.

An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient.
Introduction of genetic material into cells in order to correct or treat an inherited or acquired disease.
A medical procedure that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population, which is not considered a surgical procedure.
Use of targeted or whole body radiation to treat a disease.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

A medicinal product inducing immunity against disease, most often to prevent occurrence of a disease, (e.g., a preventative vaccine against infectious disease), but also to treat a disease, (e.g., a therapeutic vaccine against cancer). (CDISC Glossary)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Intervention Type Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Intervention Use Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the intervention use responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A medicinal product that must be administered along with the experimental treatment (e.g., drug studies wherein opioid blockers are administered to prevent overdose).

Medicinal products that are administered to each clinical trial participant, regardless of randomization group, a) to treat the indication which is the object of the study, or b) required in the protocol as part of standard care for a condition that is not the indication under investigation, and is relevant for the clinical trial design. (CDISC Glossary)

A non-investigational medicinal product (NIMP) given to trial participants to produce a physiological response that is necessary before the pharmacological action of the investigational medicinal product can be assessed. (CDISC Glossary)
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

The drug, device, therapy, procedure, or process under investigation in a clinical study that is believed to have an effect on outcomes of interest in a study (e.g., health-related quality of life, efficacy, safety, pharmacoeconomics). (CDISC Glossary)
A pharmaceutical preparation that does not contain the investigational agent and is generally prepared to be physically indistinguishable from the preparation containing the investigational product.

Medicinal products identified in the protocol as those that may be administered to participants when the efficacy of the investigational medicinal product (IMP) is not satisfactory, the effect of the IMP is too great and is likely to cause a hazard to the patient, or to manage an emergency situation. (CDISC Glossary)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Intervention Use Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Investigational Intervention Sourcing Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the sourcing value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An indication that the entity is obtained from a central source.
An indication that the entity is obtained from a local source.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Sourcing Value Set Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217286.Investigational Medicinal Product Indicator Response Terminology
CodeList.Name: Investigational Medicinal Product Indicator Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the investigational medicinal product indicator responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A medicinal product which is being tested or used as a reference, including as a placebo, in a clinical trial.
A medicinal product that is related to the specific needs of the clinical trial as described in the protocol, but not as an investigational medicinal product. (CDISC Glossary)

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: Investigational Medicinal Product Indicator Response Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Investigational Medicinal Product Indicator Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Investigational Medicinal Product Indicator Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: No Yes Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the no yes value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The affirmative response to a question.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 No Yes Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Population Type Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the population type responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An indication that the individual or group of individuals has been diagnosed with the disease of interest or under study.
An indication that the individual or group of individuals has not been diagnosed with the disease of interest or under study.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Population Type Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Protocol Section Name and Number Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the protocol section name and number responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Protocol Section Name and Number Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Protocol Section Name and Number Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Reason for Amendment Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the reason for amendment responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A change in the standard of care necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Change in Standard Of Care Amendment Reason

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A change in the study purpose or intent of the scientific plan necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
The addition of an investigational medicinal product to a clinical trial design necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Inconsistency And/Or Error In The Protocol
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An error or inconsistency in the protocol necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Inconsistency and/or Error in the Protocol Amendment Reason

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Feedback from the investigator or study site necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
Feedback from the institutional review board or independent ethics committee necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
A change to manufacturing processes of the study agents necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: New Data Available (Other Than Safety Data)
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Previously unavailable data (other than safety data) becomes available, which necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New Data Available (Other Than Safety Data) Amendment Reason

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A regulatory agency has published a guidance document that necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
Previously unavailable safety data becomes available, which necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New Safety Information Available Amendment Reason

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A protocol design error necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a document.
Challenges with participant recruitment necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
A regulatory agency has expressed a need for a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Regulatory Agency Request to Amend Amendment Reason

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Reason for Amendment Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Sponsor Approval Date Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the sponsor approval date responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The physical or virtual location of the date on which the sponsor approved the current version of the protocol.
The date that the sponsor approved the current version of the protocol.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Sponsor Approval Date Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Trial Arm Type Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the trial arm type responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An arm describing the active comparator.

An arm describing the intervention or treatment plan for a group of participants in the study receiving a control. The control may comprise a non-investigational product (active control) or regimen, placebo, or no treatment.
An arm describing the intervention or treatment plan for a group of participants in the study receiving test product(s).
A study arm without an intervention or treatment.
An arm describing the placebo comparator.
An arm describing the sham comparator.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Arm Type Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Trial Blinding Role Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the trial blinding role responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.

A person responsible for the conduct of the clinical trial at a trial site. If a trial is conducted by a team of individuals at the trial site, the investigator is the responsible leader of the team and may be called the principal investigator.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
The individual who evaluates the outcome(s) of interest. (CDISC)
A member of the clinical study population from whom data are being collected. (CDISC Glossary)
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the trial sponsor.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Blinding Role Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Trial Blinding Schema Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the trial blind schema value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A study in which neither the participant nor the study personnel interacting with the participant or data during the study knows what intervention a participant is receiving.

A study in which the study personnel who measure, record, or assess the participant do not know which intervention the participant is receiving or, in the context of observational studies, do not know the external factors to which a participant has been exposed.
A study in which participants and study personnel know which intervention each participant is receiving.
A study in which one party, either the participant or study personnel, does not know which intervention is administered to the participant.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Blind Schema Value Set Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217280.Trial Intervention Assignment Method Response Terminology
CodeList.Name: Trial Intervention Assignment Method Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the trial intervention assignment method responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: The process of assigning trial participants to treatment or control groups using an element of chance to determine the assignments in order to reduce bias. (CDISC Glossary)
Grouping defined by important prognostic factors measured at baseline.

The process of grouping trial participants into strata according to important prognostic factors and then assigning participants within each stratum to different treatment or control groups using an element of chance and in order to reduce bias.

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: Trial Intervention Assignment Method Response Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Trial Intervention Assignment Method Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Intervention Assignment Method Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Trial Phase Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the trial phase value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: First-in-human trials, in a small number of participants, that are conducted before Phase 1 trials and are intended to assess new candidate therapeutic and imaging agents. The study agent is administered at a low dose for a limited time, and there is no therapeutic or diagnostic intent.

The initial administration of an investigational medicinal product (IMP) into humans in order to examine clinical tolerability and therapeutic intent. Phase 1 trials are typically closely monitored and may be conducted in patients or healthy volunteer participants.
A clinical trial that combines elements characteristic of traditional Phase 1 and Phase 2 trials.
A clinical trial that begins as a Phase 1 trial and transitions into Phases 2 and 3 based upon successful completion of a milestone that enables transition.
A clinical trial that begins as a Phase 1 trial and transitions into a Phase 3 trial based upon successful completion of a milestone that enables transition.

Exploratory trials conducted to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the investigational intervention in patients with the disease or condition. Objectives can be clinical pharmacology, dose-ranging (dose-response, frequency of dosing), type of patients, or numerous other characteristics of safety and efficacy.
A clinical trial that combines elements characteristic of traditional Phase 2 and Phase 3 trials.
A clinical trial that begins as a Phase 2 trial and transitions into Phases 3 and 4 based upon successful completion of a milestone that enables transition.

Confirmatory trials conducted to demonstrate safety, efficacy and tolerability of the intervention in patients with the disease or condition. Their objectives are to evaluate the overall benefit-risk relationship and to provide substantial evidence for regulatory approval and labeling.
A clinical trial that combines elements characteristic of traditional Phase 3 and Phase 4 trials.

Post-approval trials conducted to further understand the safety and efficacy of the drug in its approved indication. They are not considered necessary for approval but are often important for optimising the drug's use.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Phase Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Trial Site Distribution Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the site distribution value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A clinical trial conducted according to a single protocol but at more than one site, and therefore, carried out by more than one investigator.
A clinical trial that is conducted at a single site.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Site Distribution Value Set Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217050.Trial Site Geographic Scope Response Terminology
CodeList.Name: Trial Site Geographic Scope Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the site geographic scope value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Of, or pertaining to, an occurrence in more than one country.
Of, or pertaining to, an occurrence in one country.

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: Trial Site Geographic Scope Response Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Trial Site Geographic Scope Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial Site Geographic Scope Value Set Terminology

CodeList.OID: CL.C217287.Trial-Related Safety Event Type Response Terminology
CodeList.Name: Trial-Related Safety Event Type Response Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: A valid value set relevant to the trial-related safety event type responses within the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.
Any event that occurs when the participant is lactating.
Any concern about the safety, quality, and/or performance of a trial-related drug-device combination.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Not Reportable Adverse Event of Special Interest
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor could be appropriate, and which is deemed to be not reportable to the appropriate regulatory authority.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Not Reportable Adverse Event of Special Interest

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Any event that occurs when the participant is in the stages of recovery post pregnancy and birth event.
Any event that occurs when the participant or participant's partner becomes pregnant or is pregnant.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: Reportable Adverse Event of Special Interest
EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor could be appropriate, and which is deemed to be reportable to the appropriate regulatory authority.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Reportable Adverse Event of Special Interest

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: Any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or any other medically significant event that may not be immediately life-threatening or result in death or hospitalisation but may jeopardise the patient or may require intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes listed in the definition.
Any concern about the safety and/or quality of any trial-related interventions.

CodeList.ich:ICHSubmissionValue: Trial-Related Safety Event Type Response Terminology
CodeList.ich:ICHSynonym: Trial-Related Safety Event Type Response Terminology
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Trial-Related Safety Event Type Value Set Terminology

CodeList.Name: Unit of Measure Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology associated with the units of measure value set codelist of the ICH M11 protocol template.

EnumeratedItem.ich:ICHDefinition: A unit of measurement of time equal to 24 hours.
A unit of measurement of time equal to 60 minutes.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: ICH M11 Units of Measure Value Set Terminology
